p: An opposite result was observed for content of chlorophyll b in rye shoots. A lower pigment content was recorded in Krona plants grown at 1.5 and 3% oil concentrations in the soil compared to the control. However, at higher levels of oil concentration, there were no significant differences compared to the control. On the contrary, the Valdai variety demonstrated a decrease in the content of chlorophyll b at an oil concentration in the soil equal to 3% or more ( Figure 1b).
